intro: Zexmenia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' zexmenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in cloud forests at high altitudes. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, Zexmenia williamsii is considered endangered and requires protection to ensure its survival.
